Posts.Content: Interesting but doesn’t hold a lot of weight in my mind. 10 year old study would have been replicated a few more times and moved in to next stage if it showed any real promise.  Plus cancer is such a diverse disease, in vitro studies may well develop areas of interest and are very necessary but there will never be a one fix for cancer as it’s as different as there are types of cells  I think the best we can do is eat well, exercise and move and if the worst happens we will at lease be in the best shape to help get us through treatment and recovery
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and fasting

Posts.Content: Welcome to the forum!  I’m not sure much can be done to prepare as you never really know what side effects you might be blessed with!  Im two rounds in, and happy to report only mild wise effects so far (weekly Paclitaxel and carboplatin every 3) l. Everything I’ve experience has been thankfully short lived as there is usually something to be done to help but frustratingly one can lead to another... last weeks sore gums, helped by mouthwash has made my tastebuds go funny!    I think it’s helped that I have been mentally prepared, taking lots of nice walks, resting when I can and trying to keep things as normal as possible (if slower paced!)  I try to drink loads of water and am being reasonably sensible about food in that I’m conscious to eat veg/fruit plenty of protein and healthy fats but I am eating an astonishing amount of cake too! I’m trying to give my self a break, make sensible choices, move as much as possible and rest when I need to. Doesn’t always work and sounds a lot smugger than I actually am! I allow myself days to cry into my coffee and take my dog into the woods to sear and have a good ugly cry! And the odd G&T when I feel like it! Good luck and  I hope treatment is kind xx
Posts.Title: tips to reduce side effects before starting chemo, please

Posts.Content: I was technically aware I had cancer in March but confirmed in april.  Patiently waiting on May Chemo club thread to start! Who else is in? Feeling quite daunted by the whole thing now I have a plan.  Planning on mentioning something to my 5 year old this week. Am planning on reading the ‘mummys Lump’ book and just saying I need to go in for hospital to have some medicine each week. I dont think I want to tell him the exact date though as he will probably go home from school that Friday and stay at at his grannies so I don’t want him to worry.  Having some drinks with friends on Friday night, weekend off, hair chop Monday and start chemo Friday!
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: I’m taking part (hopefully- confirming Thursday) in a trial so having 12 lots of weekly chemo then 4 rounds of 3 weekly (6 bloody months!)  Going to try cold cap too but my hair is really thick and long so totally unmanageable for cold capping. I’ve never had hair shorter than my shoulders so nervous about getting the chop!  I put henna on my naturally ginger hair to cover grey (it’s very red)  so I’m dreading not being able to do that!
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: I got confirmation of TNBC last week, and I have been quite relaxed abut it since as I had got myself in a right state in the weeks before, thinking the very worst. It was a relief to be told into ‘just’ in my breast and lymph node (x1 that we know of) even managed a hen weekend this weekend but I came back today instead of tomorrow because my ability to hold it together was waining! The best balance fro me seems to be carry on as normal but allow myself a wobble every few days to let it all out!  I’m im for the first meeting with oncology on Tuesday do it will be nice to have a plan in place so I can arrange my life! How’s everyone else doing?
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Bit of a random one, but sis any of you ladies have to have your IUD out (specifically copper coil) before diagnostic MRI?  My consultant said to make an app it with my GP. To have it out but it was a bit of a afterthought comment and I’m now questioning whether I actually need to? It’s copper. Surely that’s not a ferrous metal?  It’s just another job I really can’t face right now, but o don’t want to delay my Scans. Two bloody more weeks is already too long.
Posts.Title: MRI scan -copper coil IUD

Posts.Content: My lovely midwife friend called them for me this morning and they have confirmed it doesn’t need to be out. I’m really cross, what is my consultant thinking? Like I need more thing to stress about!
Posts.Title: MRI scan -copper coil IUD

Posts.Content: I have a vicious headache again this week (week. 2 of cycle 1) which I think must be the filgrastim as it was the same last week. Last one today though so look forward to a proper nights sleep tomorrow.  I’m going to try and work for a couple of hours tomorrow too.  Hair is annoying me. Scalp is quite itchy and sore so I guess it’s started shedding (I’m cold capping) so I need to stop washing it every few days really, however gently.
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hey fellow May peeps! I’m starting on 11th. Diagnosed on 22nd March so feeling like I need to do something! It’s been ages. All being well (confirming this Thursday) I’ll be on the Partner trial for triple neggers so starting off with T+carbopaximol Weekly plus possibly Olaparib, depending which arm of the trial I get randomised.  Hoping to get some tips from you ladies xx
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Is feeling really spaced out a side effect? I’m on day 6 of round 1 and I was hoping to feel a bit more normal today as no more steroids/filgrastim for a few days (that I thought might be responsible for the headache and bone ache) but man I just feel weird today. Like I’m watching myself? Or maybe a bit drunk?
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I’m struggling with the whole not being ill thing. I feel kind of guilty that I’m doing ok, mainly because I’m not working. I work for myself, and the guilt is about not contributing to the bills and mortgage. Every day that I say ‘actually I’m doing ok’ it makes me think I should have gone to work!  I am doing ok, but I am having lot s of naps. Only because I can, while my son is at school. I know emotionally I would struggle with work (I am a chiropractor so quite physical and also a lot of my patients offload a lot of emotional stuff on me too) I’m claiming ESA (or trying too) so I could possibly work up to 4 hours a week, without affecting that. But my jobisnt one where I can just decide to work one day I have to book patients in in advance. My husband is having to pay for everything which I know he is struggling with, and we will probably add to our debt considerably as a result. But what if I say I’ll work a few hours a week and end up not bei able to?
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Anyone else having weekly chemo? I’m in very friday, (weekly Paclitaxel and carboplatin every 3rd week) 1 down so far and SE seem to be minimal. Saying that I’m awake at this time of the night with bone pain and a headache! Not unbearable but stuff doesn’t usually keep me awake. Might just be the general dark cloud I feel under the last few days. Not sure why. I’ve been surprisingly positive, I guess it’s just feeling like 6 long months ahead.  I’m heartened by managing to carry on pretty much as normal so far but this sense of impending doom!
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Morning ladies. I had my first Paclitaxel and Carboplatin yesterday. Was more eventful than I expected as I had problems with my veins and they couldnt find a cold cap to fit as they only had one large one and it was being used! I had o wait for the lady to finish. Then tey had trouble canulating me. First failed, second ok till half way though carbo then vein had enough! Had some weird local reaction. Then it took 2 hours to get another one in! I’m full of holes! Port fitting next week thank god. I was there 10 hours!  Feel ok this morning but woke up so early! Conscious of ‘overdoing it’ but not really sure what that is? Might take the dog out in a bit.  Do I take metaclopramide even if I don’t feel nauseous? They said take it 3xdaily for 3 days then as required? But I feel ok so it seems a bit unecessary?  Hope you are all doing ok?
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I’m glad it’s wasn't bad news but sorry you don’t feel satisfied with the outcome.  Might not help but I did have terrible problems with mastitis and blocked ducts while breastfeeding and yes they could be a bit itchy.  Even since then I have still got really lumpy areas that could be really sore, similar to when I was Bfeeding so I can kind of see that it might happen when you are not feeding.  My tumour annoying is similar to a lumpy ‘normal’ area for me but since it was pointed it it is quite obvious that it hasn’t changed through a whole cycle, unlike the rest of my breasts.  Hope that helps?
Posts.Title: my appointment confused
